fields.description:
It is possible to create a board based on a filter with no shares. The creator can see the board but the relevant info in the board config "No shares" is not called out/obvious.

Additionally for viewers of the board the generic message "The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it." offers no assistance.
fields.summary: Improved messaging that a board is based on a filter with no shares

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sprints can now be affected by complex filters on the origin board if the filter is too complex. The manage sprints permission introduces the "origin board concept for sprint". If the filter query for a sprint is complex (several clauses) it requires the filter either be simplified or the user must have the manage sprints permission for all projects in the instance not just associated projects with the filter. This can cause problems managing a sprint if it exist in several boards as there isn't an easy way via the UI to identify origin board the sprint was created on to resolve the issue. 

See blog post [Updates on the planned second release of sprint management permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2016/02/updates-on-the-planned-second-release-of-sprint-management-permission] and  [Sprints shared between multiple boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Sprints+shared+between+multiple+boards] for reference. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide a UI method that will show the origin board of sprint to resolve the complex query issue. 

h3. Workaround 

- *Cloud users:*
You can use the REST endpoint [GET sprint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-sprint/#api-agile-1-0-sprint-sprintid-get].

That will return a key called *originBoardId*, with the id of the board as its value.

You can get the id of a sprint by hovering over it in the backlog, and then checking the URL at the bottom of the page, or performing an advanced search:
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-09 at 09.36.14.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-11-09 at 09.50.24.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-11-12 at 14.52.30.png|thumbnail! 

Once you get the id of that board via the endpoint, you can go to that board by using the URL:
{code}https://<YOUR SITE>.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<BOARD ID> {code}


- *Server users:*
Please contact your Database administrator for  your JIRA DB to execute the following query to find the origin board for a sprint:
{code}
select b."ID", b."NAME" as board_name, s."NAME" as sprint_Name from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" s, "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" b where s."NAME" = '<SprintName>' and s."RAPID_VIEW_ID" = b."ID";
{code}
*The above SQL was written for Postgres. Syntax for the query may need to be adjusted for your DB engine.*
fields.summary: Provide UI method to identify origin board for a sprint.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description 

If column A in a board contains multiple statues, clicking and moving issue to another column, will show all the available statuses on column A. However, if column B only contains one status, it will *not* be shown.

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great if the status in column B is shown even if it only contains 1 issue.
fields.summary: Show the status on each column even if it only contains one status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13263].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*

# View an Agile Board. Notice how the epic and version "tags" on each item are right-aligned, and on the same line as the issue title.
# Click the "current sprints" button on the left
# Click the "backlog" button on the left


*Expected Outcome*
Layout of the issues in the backlog view is as described above


*Actual Outcome*
The epic and version "tags" are left-aligned, and show up immediately under the issue key.


*Notes*
Refreshing the page (cmd-R on OS X) fixes the layout issue, but when you repeat the steps above, it happens consistently.

This only started happening recently, so I suspect it was a recent on-demand version which introduced this bug.
fields.summary: Layout of items on Backlog View changes after viewing current sprints

fields.description:

If an issue is Done or Closed within an Epic you would expect it to have the Green Circle & White Tick symbol against it (as highlighted within the green box on the screen shot attached)
You would not expect to have the same symbol for an issue that is currently reported as "In-Progress" status. Highlighted as the red box on the attached screen shot)
I have no idea what is causing this issue. I have checked the workflow and it seems to be correct.

fields.description:
In JIRA, during process to end a sprint.  After clicking the 'Complete Sprint' button from the teams 'Work' board.  A message indicating that In-progress tickets will be copied to the next open sprint would improve usability. 

The documentation 'Ending a Sprint - Atlassian Documentation' indicates this.  By adding it to the dialogue displayed after clicking the 'Complete Sprint' button would be very helpful.

We have run into this several times.

fields.description:
Calls using greenhopper are throwing an IllegalStateException. *Steps to reproduce* # Do any greenhopper call using curl. For example: {code} curl -D- -X GET -H "Authorization: Basic [username:password in base64]" -H "Content-Type: application/json" '[jira url]/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/sprintreport?rapidViewId=148&sprintId=449' {code} *Expected results* * A json is returned with the requested data *Actual results* * An error 500 HTML page is returned with the following stack trace: {code} java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot create a session after the response has been committed
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot create a session after the response has been committed
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.Request.doGetSession(Request.java:2934)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.Request.getSession(Request.java:2310)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.RequestFacade.getSession(RequestFacade.java:897)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginHttpRequestWrapper.getSession(PluginHttpRequestWrapper.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginHttpRequestWrapper.getSession(PluginHttpRequestWrapper.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginHttpRequestWrapper.getSession(PluginHttpRequestWrapper.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginHttpRequestWrapper.getSession(PluginHttpRequestWrapper.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginHttpRequestWrapper.getSession(PluginHttpRequestWrapper.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginHttpRequestWrapper.getSession(PluginHttpRequestWrapper.java:140)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper.getSession(HttpServletRequestWrapper.java:238)
	...
{code}

*Notes*
* Using the same url in the browser (while logged in) works fine.
* Using /rest/api/2/ calls work fine always (without greenhopper).
fields.summary: Greenhopper calls result in IllegalStateException: Cannot create a session after the response has been committed

fields.description: Often when I click on an issue it is because I am about to move it to different swim-lane and not because I want more details about the issue. It would be great to be able to disable displaying the side-panel issue information on a per-user basis.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13231].
  {panel}

When you view the product backlog first time, css class for the body is "ghx-plan-band-2"
but when you go to another screen (i.e. current sprint) and come back, the body class is set to "ghx-plan-band-1". 

But this time, backlog rows become higher because ".ghx-row.ghx-end" class is not styled correctly.

If you have too many issues on the backlog, this becomes harder to track from a UX viewpoint

fields.description:
It would be great if we could configure a warning popup, if the user tries to add a Story/Issue to a planned/ongoing Sprint, when the Story is not in a certain status. 

Agile/Scrum Teams often use a "Definition of Ready" gateway to take stories for the next sprint. We have a configured a dedicated workflow step, a status called "Ready for Implementation" for this. When reaching this status, the workflow ensures that all relevant fields were filled before. We would like to prevent users, from adding Issues to a sprint container, which are not in this Status.

Currently, they can also add Issues in status "Open" to a sprint. Of course we could change the board filter, to display only Issues in Status "Ready for Implementation" on the Backlog. But we really like the Idea of a groomed and ranked Backlog, with the READY items on top and the rough ideas at the bottom.
fields.summary: Backlog: Prevent Stories from being added to a sprint which are not READY

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you create a new project on JIRA, you get an option to pick the project type. However, if you create a new board from a new project, there is no option for the user to pick a project type. The user only gets to choose the workflow for the project.
!Screen Shot 2016-02-16 at 09.37.05.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
The same screen to pick a project type should be shown even while creating a project and a new board.
!Screen Shot 2016-02-16 at 09.58.47.png|thumbnail!
 

h3. Workaround
For now, I would suggest to first create a project using the project type of your choice. After that, you may create a board from that project  as a workaround.
fields.summary: Create new board and new project option does not give option to pick project type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Anonymous users can no longer view JIRA Agile gadgets in Confluence pages post-JIRA7.0, due to Agile functionality now require the JIRA Software application access. 
The error on the gadget:
{code}
{"errorMessages":["You currently don't have access to perform this operation."],"errors":{}}
{code}
Screenshot:
!AgileGadget.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Not sure whats the best step here as anonymous users can at best view the project, but none of its JIRA Agile functionality would be available.  This is intended behaviour because of the introduction of [application access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-application-access-744721629.html] to replace the functionality of the *JIRA Users* global permission in JIRA 7. 
We could allow just the REST calls for these gadgets to be available to anonymous users, but not sure what the security implications are. 

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile gadgets in Confluence pages no longer work for anonymous users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13211].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Jira 6.4 instance is  responding slowly in many screens, with some screens showing timeouts.

h3. Environment
Large instance with many swimlanes or card colours configured for the Agile Kanban board

h3. Expected Results
It works with acceptable performance (20-30 sec). 

h3. Actual Results
It works slow (> 30 sec). 

h3. Notes

h4. Cause
Cause is boards with many swimlanes and card colours.

For every card colour or swimlane that is defined using JQL, the entire board query is run again, with the additional JQL appended. So if no swimlanes or card colours are defined and the board opens in N seconds, each swimlane or card colour defined is guaranteed to increase the load time by at least another N seconds. Given 5 swimlanes + 2 card colours + the actual board query, this board will take at least 8*N seconds to open.

2 Problems:
# For the customer's instance: "N" is large (lucene is not performant)
# We're running a lot of queries each time we display the board.

h3.Workaround
Remove swimlanes or card colours from the configuration.
Please check KB article: [Kanban board loading is slow - performance problems|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Kanban+board+loading+is+slow+-+performance+problems]
fields.summary: Slow Kanban response and performance after upgrade to Jira 6.4

fields.description:
Hello

h3. Feature suggestion
It would be great to have the ability to switch between different swimlanes on the fly, rather than having it being a board setting.

h3. Use case
As a scrummaster, I need to have a board where I can see the sprint with swimlanes based on stories, so I can quickly spot what subtasks remain for each story.

However for the daily scrum I need another board where swimlanes are based upon assignee. I had to create two boards, and each time I introduce a configuration change in one board, I have to copy it over to the other one.

h3. Conclusion
Other people or situation might also shed light on the need for other swimlanes, based upon the same board. Basically, to me, the swimlane should not be a hard coded setting in the board, but a quick filter that you can change any time depending on your current and ever changing need.
fields.summary: Ability to switch between multiple swimlanes configurations from the quickfilter area

This could either happen as a side effect of the Welcome to JIRA Software screen or the user management creation process. I thinkt that this is a much, much more sensible default for JIRA Software users.
fields.summary: As a new JIRA Software user my default homepage should be "Boards"

fields.description:
I know you ask that I search before adding an issue. However, search is very liberal and not easily filtered and so my issues are rarely addressed by search returns. I am giving written feedback as a last ditch effort to get some help, and even finding this took upwards of 5 minutes (way too long for a feedback box).

My main issue is that documentation explains features from a development perspective, which doesn't serve me as I am a business user and would like features discussed more broadly so that I may relate them to my work.

Documentation is either very sparse or not tagged well because, like I said, searching hardly every addresses my needs. I am rarely able to use documentation to solve my problems, and the learning curve on this product is steep so I've spent several months just fumbling around trying to "figure it out." This product is so full of features and functional that it (and those who created it) deserve better documentation to help customers actually use and work with it. As things are, I use it sparingly because I never really know where to find things on a board designed for developers when I am in a very different business field. The features are also named and labeled using industry terms like "scrum," which means nothing to me and requires research before I can know to look for something else, which is often also not labeled in a straight-forward manner.

At the moment, I am trying to learn the differences between various project types (for about the 5th time; thought I understood, but somehow I am constantly finding new info that wasn't available before...) as well as how to delete or back up data, none of which simple searches have been able to explain.

I may not be developer-style computer savvy but I am no Luddite either, and this should be way easier. One good start would be to include a text box in the page-specific feedback area (instead of the multiple choice of three vague options). You'll get better page-specific feedback that may allow your teams to address needs better than via a separate task or suggestion that is now removed from its context... Another good place to start would be to consider that development language does not always translate across industries, and when you claim to address regular business needs, your help language should reflect that.

I'm sorry if this sounds harsh. I like the product overall; I'm just very frustrated that help is so hard to come by. I can't even call anyone...
fields.summary: Documentation Suggestions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In certain use cases like designing projects, it is crucial that the card can also display images. However, currently this is not possible. 

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Create a custom field and add it into an agile ticket (e.g.: Single line text: Text field = lol)
 # Create an agile board (no matter which one)
 # Go to: Board > Configure > Card Color
 # Select option Query > Select a color and type:
 {{"Text field" = lol}}
 P.s.: You can also try {{"Text field" = "lol"}}

*Expected Results:*
 On the board, the cards that have this custom field would be with the color that you have previously chosen.

*Actual Results:*
 Nothing happens with the card. No colors changed.

*Workaround:*
 —

*Add-on Version:*
 JIRA Agile v7.1.17-D20160127T234517

JIRA Agile v1000.386.0

*Notes:*
 This does not happen if you choose any JIRA default field, like: assignee, issue type, component, etc. This seems to be only happening to custom fields.
fields.summary: Unable to customize card color when using custom field on JQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After the JIRA Cloud update on 07-Feb-2016 to version 7.1.0-OD-06-005, Agile version 7.1.17-D20160127T234517, several reports of issues previous linked to Epics are no longer linked to them.

We can also see in these cases that the removal of child issues from Epics is not in the Epics history, as it would be if the child issues were actually removed by users.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In an affected issue, go to an Epic that had child issues

h3. Expected Results
This shouldn't have been changed in the update.

h3. Actual Results
The issues are no longer connected
 
h3.Workaround
Contact [Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] for a fix.
fields.summary: Epics child issues lost link to parents after JIRA Cloud update

fields.description:
Would like the option for JIRA Administrators to be able to specify the default global kanban sub-filter used to seed new kanban boards.

The issue we're seeing is, people create a few boards for a Project and when one of them creates a Release to clear things from their board, it disappears from everyone else's board.  Additionally, if people create boards that span Projects which they may not be Admins in, they cannot create Releases in those Projects and thus get an error when they try to create a Release on their board.

So the current default sub-filter is sub-optimal for us and we'd like to change it to something like:

{code}resolution is EMPTY OR (resolution is not EMPTY AND resolved > -7d){code}

so as to have things drop off our Kanban board automatically after 7 days which is a more logical way to manage a Kanban board rather than having to constantly create Releases to clear it.  And we'd like the ability to make that the default so we don't have to constantly have users 'fix' their kanban boards.
fields.summary: Customize the global default kanban sub-filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Since the latest release of JIRA Software, in order to have a complex board filter (e.g: label query), users need to have Manage Sprints permission throughout all projects in order to Start/Close sprints in a board. It is an expected behavior but at the moment there is no documentation pertaining this behavior. It is also not mentioned in the Reintroducing sprint management in JIRA Software Cloud blog post:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2016/01/reintroducing-sprint-management-in-jira-software-cloud

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the current documentation to reflect this behavior.
fields.summary: Update documentation on Managing Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It might be confusing that how many issues there are actually on a Active Sprint page with Epic swimlane.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Kanban board on a project
# Create an Epic and a Task (any issuetype is ok)
# Set Epic swimlane on the board

h3. Actual Results
The Kanban board shows there are two Backlogs but there is only one issue card.
(It must be an intended feature but it might be confusing.)
 !kanban.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected Results
The board should show the information more understandable.

h3. Notes
Especially, if the following filter is set on the board and 'Epic' issuetype is excluded from the board, it could be more confusing.
{code}
PROJECT = <project name> AND ISSUETYPE in (Task) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

Then, even though it shows that there are one backlog, there is no card on the board as follows.
 !kanban2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: It might be confusing that how many issues there are actually on a Kanban board with Epic swimlane

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to have a quick filter option by user so that we can quickly see a project's tasks on the same Kanban by a single user.

Currently a board administrator would need to configure the board's quick filters, add a single user which works for only a few users -- not exactly elegant or scalable.

Ideally, it would be an auto-complete dropdown beside the quick filters allowing any user viewing a Kanban board to select a user and view tasks assigned to that user.

Thanks!

I believe updating in quarters is enough to indicate how much is completed without getting too subjective.

fields.description:

The option defaults to backlog.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When refining report, users are able to select multiple Column/Swimlane/Filter. However, when a button is selected, the only difference is the colorr is slightly darker. This is not obvious at all and users might have trouble seeing the difference between the selected/non-selected buttons

h3. Suggestion

fields.summary: Refine Report of Cumulative Flow Diagram is not clear

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There isn't any consistency to Version report, Sprint report and Release Burndown chart to whether Epic column should be rendered across the reports.

In Version report, the Epic column only included for *Completed Issues* subtopic while *Incomplete Issues* are not. Other reports do not include Epic column on both completed and incomplete issues.

!versionreport.png|thumbnail! !sprintreport.png|thumbnail! !releaseburndown.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Add Epic column to all reports for consistency and better user experienced.
 

h3. Workaround 
Click on "View in Issue Navigator" and add the *Epic Link* column to it.
fields.summary: Create Consistency between Reports on Epic column

fields.description:
A common set of questions that come up from our many Atlassian customers are related to what happens in the life of a sprint and what else is affected. I suggest creating a page in the documentation to answer these questions in one place together. The list of questions below are what people ask me.

h2. Create Sprint

How are issues with no estimate shown in the Backlog panel?

Why are estimates on sub-tasks not included in the Backlog panel?

h2. Start Sprint

What happens to issues that are added to the sprint after the sprint is started?

They are shown as a Scope Change in the Reports. Their estimates are not included in the reports.

What happens to issues whose estimate is changed after the sprint is started?

A snapshot of the issues in the sprint is taken to be used for the Sprint Report and Velocity Report. So changes to estimates do not appear in the reports.

Which reports show scope creep and how are those numbers calculated exactly?

h2. Close Sprint

Can I add an issue to a Closed sprint? 

Can I remove an issue from a Closed sprint?

Can I modify an issue's estimate after a sprint has been closed? Which reports are affected and which are not affected?
fields.summary: Document the key moments in a sprint and what they affect

fields.description:
The visibility of an Agile Board is based on the Board's Filter Permissions. To modify it, a user has to follow: [How to restrict the access to JIRA Agile Scrum board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-resources/jira-agile-faq/how-to-restrict-the-access-to-jira-agile-scrum-board]

*Problems:*
# There is no indication of the Filter governing the Visibility or Permissions of the Board on JIRA.
# If the Filter was created by another user, a copy of the filter has to be created and configured back on the Agile Board.

The Boards view shows the visibility:
!boards.jpeg|thumbnail! but no indication that the "Saved Filter" is the setting the permissions.

Clicking ... Configure takes you to the Boards General Configuration screen that reads:
{quote}
*General and filter*
The Board filter determines which issues appear on the board. It can be based on one or more projects, or custom JQL depending on your needs.
{quote} 
It doesn't mention Filter Permissions.
There are Project Permissions on that same screen that misleads. If a Board is assigned to 1 project, it would make sense that Board Visibility Permission would be on that section.


*Suggestion:* Simplify the Board Visibility configuration to make it more intuitive.

*Ideas:*
* Show a tooltip when Hoovering over the Visibility Restriction to show the Filter's Permissions.
* Add a note on the Board General Configuration
* Have a Edit Visibility option that would create a copy of the filter an allow Permission changes.
fields.summary: Simplify Board Visibility management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13138].
  {panel}

As a Greenhopper Scrum product owner, I want story estimates to automatically total to the sum of the estimates for all sub-tasks IF and ONLY IF subtasks are entered (else I want story estimates to be manual entry) so that I can view on the scrum board the original estimate against the remaining time.

Definition of Done:
1)  When no sub-tasks exist for a story, the estimate field for the story allows entry of a value manually
2)  When one or more sub-tasks exist for a story, the estimate field for the story is calculated as the sum of the estimates for all sub-tasks for that story

Context:

I'm finding a feature in Greenhopper to NOT operate as I would have expected. The feature is in estimating where the estimation on the scrum board is configured for original time estimates. What I would like is: 
1) when no sub-tasks are created for a story, the estimation and remaining fields are editable within the story 
2) when sub-tasks have been created, the story estimate and remaining fields are calculated as the sum of the estimate and remaining fields for the sub-tasks 

What's currently happening is that the story estimate field is not calculated from the sum of the sub-tasks but the story remaining field is. Worse, if you enter a value in the story estimate field when sub-tasks have been added and estimated, the value entered into the story estimate field is added to the story remaining field, which already has the sum of the sub-tasks. Thus, if, as a work around, you try to manually enter a story estimate that equals the sum of the sub-task estimates, the story remaining field value doubles. There's no work around for this. This feature seems poorly defined. I understand what the product team was trying to accomplish... the ability to estimate and view remaining values for stories that have no sub-tasks or prior to sub-tasks being added. What they missed is that the field could serve both functions - manual entry when no sub-tasks exist and calculated value when sub-tasks do exist. I strongly urge the product team to consider this feature at their earliest opportunity as the inability to see from the scrum board the original estimate against the remaining value in plan and work mode is a problem. 

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Configure Scrum board to use "Original Time Estimate" for Estimation Statistic
# Configure Scrum board to use "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" for Time Tracking
# Create an issue with issue type Story, without specifying any Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate
# Create 2 sub-tasks for this issue.
#* Sub-task 1 has Remaining Estimate of 4 hours
#* Sub-task 2 has Remaining Estimate of 2 hours
# Checking parent of sub-tasks in Issue View, Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate is now shown as 6 hours
# Navigate back to Scrum board, open Issue Detail View, and Original Estimate for parent issue is _Unestimated_
fields.summary: Sum estimates from sub-tasks in user stories

fields.description:
h4. +Scenario+
When the following conditions are met:
# project A and project B use the same workflow WF
# project A is managed in board A and project B is managed in board B
# the column mappings in board A and board B are the same
# project A and B are managed by the same admin

And the admin performs the following actions:
# edit workflow WF and add a new status S to it (and publish it)
# configure board A's columns and map status S to column C (any of the available columns)

h4. +Suggestion+
The following feature should be available:
# JIRA/Agile asks the admin if the same mapping should be done in board B (or any other boards detected to be using the same set of workflow and columns)
# the admin should be able to accept or reject this bulk update

(i) This is helpful in case there're multiple projects managed in separate boards that use the same workflow/columns and a new status is added to the workflow. Currently the admin has to manually map the new status to the same column in every board.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk update column mappings in multiple boards that use the same workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users still need "Administer Project" permission to create sprint even if they have "Manage Sprints" permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Grant "Manage Sprints" permission to an user 
# Log in as the user and then try creating an sprint

h3. Expected Results
"Manage Sprints"  should allow users creating/completing sprints
 
h3. Actual Results
 "Administer Project" permission is required
fields.summary: Users still need "Administer Project" permission to create sprint even if they have "Manage Sprints" permission

fields.description: It's a report for one of our epics and just in one big task with many tasks inside we have more than 100 hours logged. How is it possible to show 2d 6h done?
fields.summary: Epic Report doesn't show an accurate information

fields.description:
The "Assign To Me" shortcut doesn't work with the Kanban Board.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Kanban Board
2. Select Issue
3. Try to assign to your user with "i"

The "Assign Issue" shortcut works. Would it be possible that you enable the "Assign To Me" shortcut for Kanban Boards too? Thank you!
fields.summary: Kanban Board "Assign To Me" Shortcut

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13129].
  {panel}

Currently, estimate on issue is shown in hours basis.

However, the sum of the estimate on the backlog, still indicating on days and weeks. See below:

!Screen Shot 2016-01-28 at 10.51.35 PM.png!

It would be great if the board can have the option to show the information only in hours for the Scrum master to have better view on total commitment.
fields.summary: To have the ability to show Summation of Time Estimate in Sprint in hours

fields.description:
Nice to have : possibility to expend or collapse all swimlanes at once.

Currently, we have to expend/collapse swimlanes one by one manually...
fields.summary: Agile boards - Expend/collapse all swimlanes

fields.description:
Sometimes, we could want to just display a swimlane per Project on agile boards.
Currently, the only alternative is making custom swimlanes which is not handy for such a basic-looking feature.
fields.summary: Agile borads - Add "Projects" as one of the possible Swimlanes mode

fields.description:
We could allow the user choose and change which Swimlane mode he wants to display (stories, queries, etc).
Configuration of custom swimlanes would remain a board config.
fields.summary: Agile boards - Let user choose the Swimlanes mode

fields.description:
On agile boards, it would be great for user to have an option to just "mute" a column, choosing to hide or show issues in each column.
Should be a user display setting, not a board configuration.
Should have the same effect as a quick filter hiding the statuses displayed in that column.

Currently, the only alternative is making Quick Filters, which is not so handy for such a basic-looking feature.
fields.summary: Agile boards - Hide issues in column

fields.description:
Currently, the "view on board" link is available only for project type "Software", which does not make sense as any type of project can get on boards.

Please, make the "view on board" link available for all project types.
fields.summary: Make "view on board" link available for all types of projects

fields.description:
I want to be able to move the active sprints into a desired order in the same way that can be done with sprints that have not been started (via the Move Sprint Up or Move Sprint Down options). 

One use case for this would be when we a new sprint is created and it needs to be scheduled between active sprints.  It would be helpful to have that sprint moved between the active sprints in the backlog view.
fields.summary: As a board admin, I would like Active Sprints in the Backlog to be ordered by date

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Agile _Version_ report is not showing _Epic_ field for _Incomplete issues_ any more. We need to update documentation page to reflect that: https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-a-board/using-reports/viewing-the-version-report

h3. Expected Results
Page [viewing-the-version-report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-a-board/using-reports/viewing-the-version-report] shows screenshot of the latest version of JIRA Agile 
 !PS_no_epic.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Page has a screenshot with _Epic_ field for _Incomplete_ issues. 
 
h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Documentation request: Agile version report is not showing Epic field for Incomplete issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13115].
  {panel}

According to recent changes, it's no longer possible to attach screenshots to issues from the Agile board view, however, it still can be done after opening the edit issue screen.

h3. Environment

JIRA Agile v7.1.13-D2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the Agile board, click on any issue and press CTRL+V. The screenshot will not be pasted on the issue.
# Press {{e}}, and close the Edit Issue screen.
# Press CTRL+V and now you will be able to attach screenshots directly from the clipboard.

h3. Notes

It stops working once you refresh the page.
fields.summary: Pasting screenshot from clipboard on Agile board only works after opening "Edit Issue Screen"

fields.description: Currently, if I want to delete an attachment from a ticket, I have to open the ticket and move out from the Board view. It would nice to be able to delete attachments within the Board view directly.
fields.summary: Delete attachments from tickets from Board view

fields.description:
1. Open issue
2. Open same issue in other tab/screen
3. assign task to person X  in tab 1.
4. assign task to the same person in tab 2.

Outcome: an error message is given. 

Desired: this is tolerated. An error message is redundant.
fields.summary: Unnecesary error message when assigning to same person in other screen

fields.description: Cannot release selected issues from Kanban board if I work on multiple projects, which have different release dates
fields.summary: Cannot release selected issues from Kanban board

My board just show time tracking in days and weeks even Jira configured to show hours and minutes. I've already re-indexed many times, activating and deactivating time tracking. Nothing had changed. I don't know what else to do.

fields.description: As a Agile Team (Scrum, Kanban) I'd like to specify swimlanes for "Projects" to group my issues by projects on multiple project boards.
fields.summary: Swimlanes by Project

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Epic issue view page will show the list of stories under it together with the issue type, status, and assignee

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to add estimation (such as story point) of those stories so the users can easily refer to it.
fields.summary: Show stories' estimation in Epic view page

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Epic and Fix Version are, by default, shown in the board's card layout. Users do not have the option to remove it. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to make these fields (Epic and Fix Version) to be optional, and the users have the option to remove it.
fields.summary: Make the Epic and Fix Version to be optional in the board Card Layout

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When I create a Scrum project, I expect to have the Story point field on the screen by default when I create a new issue of type Story or Epic. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set up a new instance of JIRA 7
# Create a new project of type "Scrum Software development"
# Create a new issue of type Story or Epic 
# Notice that the Story Point field is not on the screen.
# Running "Where is my field" returns : "The 'Story Points' field is not present on the form you are viewing"

h3. Suggested Solution
The Story point field should be available on the Create issue screen by default since this is Scrum type project.
 
h3. Workaround 
Add the Story point field to the right screens and the field will show up on the issue
fields.summary: As a user I would want the Story Point field to be on the screen when I create a Story or Epic type of issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the information in [Board tab in JIRA missing JIRA Software Application|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Board+tab+in+JIRA+missing+JIRA+Software+Application] is not documented in Migration Hub.

h3. Suggested Solution
Can we include this information on Migration Hub, so that customer will be aware of this? Or place it in JIRA Software licensing FAQ page?
fields.summary: Expired JIRA Software license will block JIRA Agile feature usability.

fields.description: If you are using the Kanban screen in a board and open the issue details panel, there is a link to the issue page, but the project name is not a link. When you work with multiple projects in a board, a link for the project would help giving you a quick access to it.
fields.summary: Add link to the project in the issue detail view

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, The card layout (on Agile  board) will display the text in plain text. Thus, anything written using wiki markup will not be rendered. Some users use this markup style text to emphasize certain value in the issue field.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have  the option for Board's card layout to be wiki markup rendered
fields.summary: Having the option for Board's card layout to be wiki markup rendered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13085].
  {panel}

*Summary*: Totals for "Remaining" and "Estimate" times are not displaying in the following places in an agile board (scrum):
- Beneath the sprint, to the right of "28 of 51 issues visible".
- "Summary of assigned work"/"Workload by assignee" pop-up dialog, in the "Original time estimate" column.

*Steps to reproduce*:
- Set up board with following config under "Estimation" tab:
-- Estimation statistic: Orignal Time Estimate
-- Time Tracking: Remaining Estimate and Time Spent
- Add issues with time estimates to this board
- Create a sprint with one or more of these issues

*Expected Outcome*: Totals for time remaining (beneath sprint) and original estimate (workload by assignee pop-up) should be displayed.

*Actual Outcome*: Totals do not display (as per screenshots).

*Additional Info*:
JIRA Cloud
Chrome 47 + Firefox
Worked fine several days ago—no settings/config have changed since that I am aware of.

Please let me know if you require any further info.
Thanks.
fields.summary: Remaining and Estimate values blank/not calculated in agile Scrum board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
End user is looking for a more streamline way of associating a ticket while moving it in JIRA Cloud. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to configure the "move issue" page to allow the association of an epic to a ticket while moving it instead of having to edit the ticket twice. 
h3. Workaround 
The current process looks like this.

# Clone ticket
# Move ticket to the correct project
# Edit issue's association to epic

There might be a way to customize this process by using [Bob's Swift Clone Plus|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JCPP] tool, unfortunately this is not available on JIRA Cloud.
fields.summary: Ability to edit move screen to allow epic association of a ticket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you move an Epic, then you would have to manually move all the Epic's Stories. 

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA should automatically handle moving Stories while what current happens when move parent task, where JIRA also moves the sub-tasks of that parent.
fields.summary: As a User, when move an Epic to another project, I want JIRA to also move the Epic's Stories with it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After upgrading JIRA 6.x to JIRA Core 7.x, Road Map gadget will not work with the following error:
{quote}
This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard.
{quote}
This is because Road Map gadget is being shipped with JIRA Software 7.x.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ship Road Map gadget with JIRA Core.
fields.summary: Road Map Gadget is being shipped with JIRA Software instead of JIRA Core

fields.description:
Video of issue: http://cl.ly/3e2b1H1B2Q20

More info:
This happens sporadically for some epics. They just don't show up when searching epic links?!?!

Repro steps:
1. Find epic and copy the text from the epic name
2. plug in text in the epic link search
Result: No result
Expected result: Epic displays in search

The only way to make this work is to do the advanced search  for "Epic Link" = EPS-2841, but this is the difficult way and it should work the other way as it does usually.
fields.summary: I can't find some Epics in "Epic Link" search in Issue Search, they don't populate!

fields.description: We would like to be able to have the velocity report accessible via a dashboard gadget. This was available in the classic board/gadget but is not in the new board version.
fields.summary: Velocity Dashboard Gadget

fields.description: When using swimlanes by stories, I would like to see the epic label (in color) in the swimlane header. Such labels are present only in stories without subtasks.
fields.summary: Epic name label in a Story swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Summary
[JRA-28748|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28748] have been implemented and certain AO objects are able to be imported. However, not all of them. Boards are too complex and have not been added in [JRA-28748|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28748].

h3. Suggestion
Have Agile Boards able to be exported/imported using project import
fields.summary: Project Import to include Agile Boards

fields.description: It would be useful customize issue row on the scrum board (plan mode). For example to show assignee or (and) reporter.
fields.summary: Customize view for issue row on the scrum board (plan mode)

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Making JIRA Agile board public no longer works in JIRA 7. This was possible in JIRA 6.

h4. Steps to reproduce the problem
# Grant *Browse Project* permission to Group: anyone in the permission scheme associate to the project
# Access the board using URL

h4. Expected Result
User should be able to view the board without having to login

h4. Actual Result
User is directed to login page, and there is no option to access the board
fields.summary: Having an option to Make JIRA Agile board public in JIRA 7

fields.description:
When configuring a board, I can Choose "Base Swimlanes" based on Story's. My Team would like to keep this view and add an additional Swimlane on Top called "FastLane" for urgent tickets. 
Like :
Swimlane 1: Fastlane
Swimlane 2: Story 1 with Status and all Sub-Tasks
                    Story 2 with Status and all Sub-Tasks

etc.
fields.summary: Fastlane on the Scrum Sprint Board

fields.description:
I want to be able to add descriptions and pictures to my sprints.

Cant seem to do that now
fields.summary: Sprint pictures

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13054].
  {panel}

When you open a board, click on backlog on the left hand menu and try to see the sum of estimate, the result it's not available, even if the tasks estimate are available we are not able to see the sum of the estimate time.

This happened on JIRA version JIRA v7.1.0-OD-04-012
I tested on version JIRA v7.1.0-OD-01-053 and it was working perfectly

There's a screenshot to exemplify the issue.

The only workaround is to sum the estimate manually, which makes the process slower.
fields.summary: Not able to estimate total on backlog of a board on sprints

fields.description:
*Version:* JIRA Agile v7.1.11-D20

h3. Problem Definition

For a user to have the ability to create and manage sprints they need the administer projects permission. However conceptually they really only need permission to create a sprint without having everything that the administer project permission entails. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Allow a create sprint permission to Permissions used in Agile boards: https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-resources/jira-agile-faq/what-are-the-permissions-used-in-agile-boards

h3. Workaround 

Currently the only workaround is to give the user full blown access to administer projects.
fields.summary: Granular Project Permissions for creating/ordering sprints

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Few number of gadgets in the Dashboard. Then click Tools>View as Wallboard in the Dashboard.  Currently . only the Issue Statistic gadgets header name from the dashboard is shown in the Wallboard.

h3. Suggested Solution
All the gadgets header name from the dashboard need to be displayed in the Wallboard.
fields.summary: All the gadget header name should be displayed in the Wallboard

fields.description:
Steps:
- Create a sprint
- Start a sprint
- Create a new Jira ticket
- Pull the new ticket to the running sprint

Expected:
- Can edit estimation for that new ticket

Actual:
- Cannot edit estimation for that new ticket
fields.summary: Cannot edit estimation for new task pulled in a running sprint

fields.description: I would like the ability to associate particular version numbers with specific components. Right now I see a whole list of versions and they may or may not apply to a particular component.
fields.summary: Associate Versions with Components

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Have an attachment that cannot be read
# Navigate to the 'Health Checks' tab of the Atlassian Support Tools section of the admin menu
# Expand the the 'Problems Detected' section

h3.Expected Behaviour

Documentation link should point to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/HealthCheck%3A+Attachments]

h3.Actual Behaviour

Documentation link point to [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-064/JIRA+Documentation] (generic JIRA documentation landing page)
fields.summary: JIRA Health Check pointing to unhelpful documentation
Remaining and Estimate values are not being displayed at bottom of sprints in backlog view

fields.description:
In an Agile board's burndown chart report, there is an option to switch the estimation statistic using a dropdown menu. This is extremely useful for teams who use story points for product backlog items but hours for sprint backlog items (sub-tasks mostly).

If the same option was available in the Agile burndown gadget (by the way of a configuration setting), one could display more than one burndown side by side on a dashboard with different estimation statistics.
fields.summary: Ability to choose estimation statistic for sprint burndown gadget
Release 4A

fields.description:
The user has permission to resolve an issue
 !20160112161323-bla.png|thumbnail! 

But the Fix Version/s field is not editable even though the documentation states that this should be the case
 !20160112160834-bla.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot change fix versions although user has Resolve Issues permission
As an Administrator I want to make 'Days in column' set to false by default for new Kanban boards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no option to remove Description and Summary Field from Issue Detail View. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Include this Issue Detailed View configuration.
fields.summary: As a admin, I want to have the ability to exclude the Description and Summary field on the Issue Detail View
